weather_report:
As darkness envelops Downtown San Francisco this evening, a symphony of raindrops begins to play—a gentle yet persistent rhythm heralding a night of wet weather. The air carries a somber chill, softening the silhouettes of the city, where the Golden Gate Bridge stands as a faint whisper against the cloudy backdrop. Visibility is notably diminished, as the looming cloud cover merges with the light from the streets below, creating a moody ambiance that invites contemplation. The south-southwest winds weave through the streets, bringing a fresh, salty scent from the bay, hinting at the ocean's embrace just beyond the horizon.

Tomorrow promises more of the same as the rain lingers, though perhaps with less fervor. As temperatures dip slightly in the afternoon, a cozy layering of clothing—perhaps a warm sweater under a waterproof jacket—will be crucial to stay comfortable. Activities might lean towards the indoors, ideal for curling up with a good book in a cozy café or exploring the local art scene, where the light from the galleries melds with the shadows of the rain-soaked streets. Given the tranquility of the rainy night and the spirit of the approaching day, this is the perfect time for reflection and quiet enjoyment.
